alert.note: Alert for Inyo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 25 at 4:16AM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast California, including the following county, Inyo. * WHEN...Until 600 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 416 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain and snow continuing. Data from weather stations in the area suggest the snow level remains near 3000 feet. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the lower elevations. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Furnace Creek, Stovepipe Wells, Shoshone, Texas Springs Campground, Death Valley Junction, Panamint Springs, Homewood Canyon-Valley Wells, Mesquite Springs Campground and Tecopa. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
